title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
pattern: Moral Awakening Through Loss of Innocence
metaDescription: Parent curriculum guide for To Kill a Mockingbird. See what your child will learn week by week.
outcomes: Identifying and analysing symbolism (mockingbird, rabid dog)
Analysing social commentary on racism and injustice
Connecting textual analysis to moral themes

weeks.title: Understanding the Text
weeks.description: Building foundational understanding of the novel
topics: Introduction to To Kill a Mockingbird and 1930s Alabama context
Meeting Scout, Jem, Atticus, and key characters

weeks.title: How the Text Works
weeks.description: Discovering how Lee constructs moral education
topics: Exploring the central pattern: Moral Awakening
Understanding how innocence is lost through understanding injustice
Recognising recurring motifs (mockingbird, Boo Radley, court)

weeks.title: Analysing Key Techniques
weeks.description: Learning to identify and analyse Lee's techniques
topics: Technique 2: First-Person Retrospective Narration (adult Scout reflecting)
Collecting textual evidence for each technique

weeks.title: Building the Argument
weeks.description: Developing a thesis and analytical argument
topics: Exploring the guiding question: How does Lee use retrospective narration to show moral awakening through confronting injustice?

weeks.title: Writing the Introduction
topics: Drafting and refining the introduction paragraph

technique.name: Symbolism
technique.description: The mockingbird symbolizes innocent individuals destroyed by societal cruelty, particularly Tom Robinson and Boo Radley.

weeks.title: Body Paragraph 2
weeks.description: Deep analysis of First-Person Retrospective Narration
topics: Building on analytical skills from Week 6
Exploring dual perspective (child Scout vs adult Scout)

technique.name: First-Person Retrospective Narration
technique.description: Adult Scout narrates childhood events, revealing moral understanding gained through experience and time.

technique.name: Social Commentary
technique.description: Lee critiques systemic racism and moral hypocrisy through Tom Robinson's trial and Maycomb's response.
